results.title: B.L.A.C.K.: an Aboriginal song of hip hop
results.creator_credit: Roslyn Baker, Grant Saunders and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
B.L.A.C.K. is a cipher scribed by independent and Indigenous Hip Hop artist, Wire MC. Through interviews and observation the song is visually and dialectically deconstructed to speak of contemporary issues around Aboriginal blackness, politics and culture.
The filmmaker, with his own roots in Hip Hop, aligns himself with Wire MC and through a rapped narrative adds another layer of complexity to notions of blackness by pulling apart his own identity.
This is a musical documentary that exposes an authentic and empowering B.L.A.C.K. voice existing underneath the hype of “bling-bling” hip hop. This is a film with rhythm, rhyme and reason.
results.title_for_label: B.L.A.C.K.: an Aboriginal song of hip hop

This is a musical documentary that exposes an authentic and empowering B.L.A.C.K. voice existing underneath the hype of “bling-bling” hip hop. This is a film with rhythm, rhyme and reason.

results.title: Arcadia
results.creator_credit: Greg Waters, Paola Garofali, Adrian Wills and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
‘I know that you’re there, because I can feel you. Why don’t you come out and play with me. In the dark I hear you breathing. Watch out for the Hairy Man…’
In Arcadia nothing is what it seems.
Cast: Hunter Page, Justine Saunders, Ursula Yovich, Damien Garvey, Pauline Lampton

results.title: Agnes, Maude and Pearly too
results.creator_credit: Kate Gillick, Charles Mitchell, Aline Jacques, Erica Glynn and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
On this day, in loving memory of Pearly, Agnes and Maude play a game on Pearly’s favourite poker machine. But when they hit the jackpot, money isn’t the only thing that comes spilling out.
Cast: Julie Godfrey (Agnes), Jacquy Phillips (Maude)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kate Gillick, Charles Mitchell, Aline Jacques, Erica Glynn and AFTRS
results.description:

results.title: Not the chosen one
results.creator_credit: William Trumble, Jeremy Parker and Yongki Liawinata
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn computer animation tells a story of a lonely man yearning for a lover. As the cold winter months pass into spring, his snowman companion melts into a woman. The man pursues the woman to discover he isn’t the chosen one and then becomes seduced by a frog.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Trumble, Jeremy Parker and Yongki Liawinata
results.description: A hand-drawn computer animation tells a story of a lonely man yearning for a lover. As the cold winter months pass into spring, his snowman companion melts into a woman. The man pursues the woman to discover he isn’t the chosen one and then becomes seduced by a frog.

results.title: The Land is your mother
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Clive Atkinson
results.brief_description: Clive “Bidja” Atkinson reminisces about his childhood, firstly in the Goulburn River region and then later in Echuca. He speaks of his love for the land and the Murray River and of his respect for the Yorta Yorta culture that has been passed on to him by his family. Clive became the first Koorie in Victoria to obtain a qualification in graphic design but no matter where his travels will take him, Clive will always return to the land of his mother.
results.description: Clive “Bidja” Atkinson reminisces about his childhood, firstly in the Goulburn River region and then later in Echuca. He speaks of his love for the land and the Murray River and of his respect for the Yorta Yorta culture that has been passed on to him by his family. Clive became the first Koorie in Victoria to obtain a qualification in graphic design but no matter where his travels will take him, Clive will always return to the land of his mother.

He speaks of his love for the land and the Murray River and of his respect for the Yorta Yorta culture that has been passed on to him by his family. Clive became the first Koorie in Victoria to obtain a qualification in graphic design but no matter where his travels will take him, Clive will always return to the land of his mother.

results.title: Yorta Yorta: the river people of the Murray 'Tongola'
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and George Nelson
results.brief_description: Yorta Yorta descendant, George Nelson, talks about his great grandfather, Thomas James or as he was more fondly known as, grandpa james. An interesting history of Echuca, missionary life and Aboriginal culture and identity.
results.title_for_label: Yorta Yorta: the river people of the Murray ‘Tongola’
results.description: Yorta Yorta descendant, George Nelson, talks about his great grandfather, Thomas James or as he was more fondly known as, grandpa james. An interesting history of Echuca, missionary life and Aboriginal culture and identity.

results.title: Deeth treo
results.brief_description: A surreal cut-out animation of a lone horse seen travelling the desert with a mortally wounded knight strapped to his back. The horse in collusion with the tree delivers the corpse to sate the tree’s canabalistic desires. A black comedy.
results.description: A surreal cut-out animation of a lone horse seen travelling the desert with a mortally wounded knight strapped to his back. The horse in collusion with the tree delivers the corpse to sate the tree’s canabalistic desires. A black comedy.

results.title: Thou shalt not...kill
results.brief_description: Thou Shalt Not Kill is a black and white cut-out animation. A priest and larrikan ride together as passengers on a train through the countryside. The larrikans’ pranks and vibrant antics play on the priests patience to test his self-control and moral beliefs…especially the one about ‘Thou Shalt Not Kill’.
results.description: Thou Shalt Not Kill is a black and white cut-out animation. A priest and larrikan ride together as passengers on a train through the countryside. The larrikans’ pranks and vibrant antics play on the priests patience to test his self-control and moral beliefs…especially the one about ‘Thou Shalt Not Kill’.
